title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Mautic before 3.2.4 is affected by stored XSS. An attacker with access to Social Monitoring, an application feature, could attack other users, including administrators. For example, an attacker could load an externally drafted JavaScript file that would allow them to eventually perform actions on the target user’s behalf, including changing the user’s password or email address or changing the attacker’s user role from a low-privileged user to an administrator account.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-35129
  • https://forum.mautic.org/c/announcements/16
  • https://labs.bishopfox.com/advisories/mautic-version-3.2.2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3px5-wjh3-9x6r
items.title: [mautic/core] Mautic stored Cross-site Scripting (XSS)

items.content_html:
The "have you forgotten your password" links in the User module in Drupal 7.x before 7.43 and 8.x before 8.0.4 allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive username information by leveraging a configuration that permits using an email address to login and a module that permits logging in.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-3170
  • https://www.drupal.org/SA-CORE-2016-001
  • http://www.debian.org/security/2016/dsa-3498
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/24/19
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/03/15/10
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/core/CVE-2016-3170.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/CVE-2016-3170.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pqv4-xgqh-j8vh
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal sensitive information disclosure

items.content_html:
A vulnerability was found in Moodle 3.6 before 3.6.7 and 3.7 before 3.7.3, where tokens used to fetch inline atachments in email notifications were not disabled when a user's account was no longer active. Note: to access files, a user would need to know the file path, and their token.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-14883
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-14883
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=393586#p1586750
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-774q-wfcp-vc2q
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Email media URL tokens were not checking for user status

items.content_html:
Drupal 8 before 8.2.8 and 8.3 before 8.3.1 allows critical access bypass by authenticated users if the RESTful Web Services (rest) module is enabled and the site allows PATCH requests.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-6919
  • https://www.drupal.org/SA-CORE-2017-002
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97941
  • http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038371
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/core/CVE-2017-6919.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/CVE-2017-6919.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/SA-2017-002
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6hpj-9xj7-2jxx
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal access control bypass vulnerability

items.content_html:
The User module in Drupal 7.x before 7.44 allows remote authenticated users to gain privileges via vectors involving contributed or custom code that triggers a rebuild of the user profile form.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-6211
  • https://www.drupal.org/SA-CORE-2016-002
  • http://www.debian.org/security/2016/dsa-3604
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/07/13/4
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/07/13/7
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/91230
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/core/CVE-2016-6211.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/CVE-2016-6211.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-frqf-9qr4-6vxf
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Saving user accounts can sometimes grant the user all roles

items.title: [drupal/core] Drupal Saving user accounts can sometimes grant the user all roles

items.content_html:
Some administrative paths in Drupal 8.2.x before 8.2.7 did not include protection for CSRF. This would allow an attacker to disable some blocks on a site. This issue is mitigated by the fact that users would have to know the block ID.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-6379
  • https://www.drupal.org/SA-2017-001
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96919
  • http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038058
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/core/CVE-2017-6379.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/CVE-2017-6379.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gxxq-fhc7-3jv9
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)

items.title: [drupal/core] Drupal Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)

items.content_html:
Persistent XSS in /course/modedit.php of Moodle through 3.7.2 allows authenticated users (Teacher and above) to inject JavaScript into the session of another user (e.g., enrolled student or site administrator) via the introeditor[text] parameter. NOTE: the discoverer and vendor disagree on whether Moodle customers have a reasonable expectation that anyone authenticated as a Teacher can be trusted with the ability to add arbitrary JavaScript (this ability is not documented on Moodle's Teacher_role page). Because the vendor has this expectation, they have stated "this report has been closed as a false positive, and not a bug."

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-18210
  • https://docs.moodle.org/38/en/Teacher_role
  • https://gist.github.com/Danbardo/4a6b0fe8cb21ec6d7c54e6ac951bdb0a
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q6vw-27c6-jv9c
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Persistent Cross-site Scripting (XSS)

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in Moodle in versions 3.11 to 3.11.3, 3.10 to 3.10.7, 3.9 to 3.9.10 and earlier unsupported versions. Insufficient capability checks made it possible to fetch other users' calendar action events.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-43560
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2021519
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=429100
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g39c-mccf-rxjv
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Insecure direct object reference (IDOR) in a calendar web service

items.content_html:
An issue was discovered in Moodle 3.x. A Teacher creating a Calculated question can intentionally cause remote code execution on the server, aka eval injection.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-1133
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=371199
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/104307
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/46551
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xh2j-q4mc-v522
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle calculated question type allows remote code execution by Question authors
